comment: Tasted batch 007 at WhiskyFest New York 2015. It's Laphroaig turned up to 11.

Batch 005. This one's a keeper. Laphroaig 10 at cask strength! For the strength and peat, it has a sweet nature about it that I find very appealing. Lemon comes through after adding some water. Beautifully long, smoky and briney finish. I have blended this with a couple of other single malts and it works very well for this!
The best whisky I have tried under 75$ if it's an option on a night out grab one because it is an excellent neat sipper
Incredibly smoke flavor.  Reminds me of smoked with pork  cut grass In the background.
Cask strength Laphroaig is THE great whisky

Batch #008

Sweet nose, barley, 
Taste is strong alcohol, smoke, finish very long and ends with a bit of butterscotch notes once smoke fades 
With water, smoke and wood, really long finish

Tasted at Laphroaig Distillery on 7/27/2016
Smoke and brine aroma dominate but vanilla presents itself as you get closer.  Taste is sweet and includes a nice bite.  Overall it's super well balanced and is just excellent.
Kinda harsh, but really good. Better than the proofed version
Not crazy with the peat flavor, super Smokey and smooth.
Balanced peat and smoke with honey and dried stone fruit notes.
First time trying. Ok. Expected more due to Islay. Had along with some She Crab soup. Fun birthday with B!
This is an interesting flavor. It reminds me of leather or an old boot.
Peat through and through.  Add water to open up cinnamon and vanilla.  Very long finish
Very rich and medicinal.  Flavor really comes out with a bit of water
Nose: grilled fish filets, banana pudding

Nose: Coal smoke, bacon, lemon, milk chocolate

Taste: savory, salt meat, black pepper
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐.  I consider myself a seasoned whiskey enthusiasts and this one does not disappoint!  Tasting notes are spot on.  A very powerful whiskey that'll warm you up on the coldest nights.
Smokey like walking in a New England forest after a severe thunder and lightning storm in July.
That’ll take some getting used to
One of the best or the best I’ve had. A small amount goes a long ways.
Peat, Smoky, so smooth. I really like this.
58% abv super wonderful flavor. Heavy peat and brine. Salty and flavorful. Much darker than expected. This stands up to the likes of Octomore cairdeas and corryvrecken. Great value

Great Islay profile. Loads of smoke before water, but not much more to it. Water opens it up as expected. Good balance of fruit and smoke. Much better with a touch of water. Not as great as Ardbeg or Lagavulin, but you can’t beat it for the price point. Great starter Islay.
